2. Compare each row representing a year to determine if the same individual has won the gold medal twice (which would mean they occurred in different years but with the same person).
3. Inspect the table and notice that the individuals' names are unique in each row except for Ryuzo Okuno, who won silver in 1994 and gold in 1998. This exception indicates that there is at least one instance where the same individual has won the gold medal twice in different years.
4. To verify if this is the only exception, go through the remaining rows (1982, 1986, 2002, 2006, and 2010) and check if the same person has won the gold medal in those years. No matching individuals are found for these years.
5. Based on the findings, it can be concluded that there is only one instance where the gold medalist for equestrian at the Asian Games did not change year-by-year (1994 and 1998), which contradicts the claim that this should happen in every year except 1994 and 1998.
